document.masterDocTitle: Revision of the North American Plant Bug Genus Megalopsallus Knight, with the Description of Eight New Species from the West (Heteroptera: Miridae: Phylinae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of the North American Plant Bug Genus Megalopsallus Knight, with the Description of Eight New Species from the West (Heteroptera: Miridae: Phylinae)

subSubSection.paragraph: DISTRIBUTION: Interior western North America from northern Mexico north to southern Oregon.

DISCUSSION:
Psallus suaedae Knight
was synonymized with
Psallus pictipes Van Duzee
by Carvalho (1958). Examination of the male genitalia of the species indicates that it is clearly a species of
Megalopsallus
, a placement corroborated by the chenopodiaceous hosts.

SPECIMENS EXAMINED: MEXICO . —
Baja California Norte:
70 km S of Rosarito, sand dunes, September 8, 1977 , Fisher and Westcott, 53 (CAS). Bahia de Los Angeles, March 31, 1973 , Doyen, Szerlip, and Powell, 13 (UCB).
Baja California Sur :
1–3 mi E of San Jose del Cabo, September 11, 1988 , E. G. Riley, 23, 3♀ (TAMU). 95 km N of Loreto, April 21, 1985 , R. T. Schuh and B. M. Massie,
Allenrolfea occidentalis
( Chenopodiaceae ), 33, 3♀ (AMNH).
Baja California :
Aqua Verde, May 26, 1921 , E. P. Van Duzee, 63, 6♀ (CAS). Econdido Bay, June 14, 1921 , E. P. Van Duzee, 1♀ (CAS). El Consuelo Dunes, J. D. Pinto, 23, 2♀ (UCR).
